greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of partitions of n into prime parts in which the largest part is the k-th prime.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..500, flattened
O. P. Gupta and S. Luthra, Partitions into primes, Proc. Nat. Inst. Sci. India. Part A. 21 (1955), 181-184.
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, b[n, i-1] + Function[p, If[p>n, 0, b[n-p, i]]][Prime[i]]]]; T[n_] := If[n == 1, 0, Table[b[n - Prime[k], k], {k, 1, PrimePi[n]}]]; Table[T[n], {n, 1, 25}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2016 after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 16 2015
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 16 2015
